tripleplay.ui.util

Class Supplier

  • java.lang.Object
    • tripleplay.ui.util.Supplier
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Destroyable

    public abstract class Supplier
extends Object
implements Destroyable
    Supplies elements. The means of achieving this depends on the situation. Common cases are to provide a fixed instance or to construct a new element for the caller to cache. Particular attention is paid to ownership and orderly resource destruction.

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Supplier()

      abstract Element<?> get()
      Gets the element.
      static Supplier withDestroy(Supplier other)

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

    • Constructor Detail

      • Supplier

        public Supplier()

    • Method Detail

      • auto

        public static Supplier auto(Element<?> elem)
        Creates a supplier that will return a previously created element the first time and null thereafter. If the element is still present when destroy is called, the element's layer will be destroyed.

      • withDestroy

        public static Supplier withDestroy(Supplier other)
        Creates a supplier that wraps another supplier and on destroy also destroys the created element, if it implements Destroyable.

      • get

        public abstract Element<?> get()
        Gets the element. Ownership of the element's resources (its layer) must also be transferred. For example, if you don't add the element to any hierarchy, you need to call its layer.destroy later.

      • destroy

        public void destroy()
        Destroys resources associated with the supplier instance. The base class implementation does nothing.
        Specified by:
        destroy in interface Destroyable
